nodes.bodyText:
If the return type Uni<T> doesn't this register whole Uni<T>  instead of just T?
We do some processing related to this in FunctionInvoker.
If possible maybe registration of FunctionInvoker::inputType and FunctionInvoker::outputType should be sufficient.
I'll check it out later on today or tomorrow morning

PR updated to exclude Mutiny types (the generics types do get registered however).
We don't need the output of FunctionInvoker::inputType or FunctionInvoker::outputType as we already know the types that need to be registered at build time by just looking at the method signatures (same as RESTEasy)

I don't think so. It should be in the RESTEasy ones though.
Basically, we need to ignore them if we have some special handling for them, which is the case for RESTEasy.
I don't see us ignoring the Mutiny types in RESTEasy, or perhaps I am just missing something?
Yeah, what I was saying is that we probably should. And definitely not do it in the generic ReflectiveHierarchyBuildItem.
Okay, I'll update the PR later on
